name: expressionist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
using or relating to expressionism (= a style of art, music, or writing, beginning in the 1900s, that tries to express people's feelings and emotions): Munch's "The Scream" is a famous expressionist painting. Rather than being linked by a linear plot, expressionist drama is structured around a theme.
More examplesFewer examplesThe design hearkens back to the expressionist cinema of Fritz Lang.Using physical and expressionist methods of theatre, the play is an inspiring and richly dark adaptation of bloody murder.

See
expressionism
someone who uses expressionism (= a style of art, music, or writing, beginning in the 1900s, that tries to express people's feelings and emotions): As an expressionist, Van Gogh's moods were frequently portrayed in his art. The Vampyre (1979) reflected the German silent film expressionists of the 1920s. See
expressionism
More examplesFewer examplesMunch was one of the first expressionists.Miller is an expressionist, lavishing pigment with a broad brush.I try be an expressionist, to use the camera to push the emotion of the scene.
